title: Mercure Edinburgh Quay opens in the heart of Edinburgh city
text:
Mercure Edinburgh Quay opens in the heart of Edinburgh city Mercure Edinburgh Quay opens in the heart of Edinburgh city Details Category: Scotland   12:30 Positioned in the heart of Edinburgh and enjoying a prime location in one of England’s most historic cities, Mercure Edinburgh Quay is now complete and open for business. Marking the 75th hotel for the Mercure brand in the UK & Ireland, the new build hotel offers a monscierge service for guests who want a very quick, hassle-free check in and check-out, demonstrating the Mercure brand’s continued commitment to putting the customer’s welcome experience at its heart. 
The main lobby area also features medium and low ‘host’ tables, which are designed to welcome guests that have time to relax whilst checking in. The hotel infuses locally inspired design elements throughout its interior such as the brand wall, which showcases a landscape view of Edinburgh, framed in local stone. There is an onsite gym, restaurant and bar and guests can also enjoy the ‘Flavours from the Cellar’ wine list, which includes three handpicked wines available across Mercure Hotels in the UK, selected by the BBC Saturday Kitchen Masters of Wine, Susie Barrie and Peter Richards. Mercure Edinburgh Quay boasts 110 bedrooms and offers guests a range of accommodation including classic rooms and privilege rooms. Each bedroom is equipped with exquisite décor and modern technology, including Apple TV’s. Ray Chandler, General Manager for Mercure Edinburgh Quay hotel said: “We are delighted with the opening of the new Mercure Edinburgh Quay hotel and are very excited for the year ahead. We are very proud of the hotel’s local heritage and are extremely pleased to have been able to depict this throughout hotel’s interior design.” Starting from £110 a night, Mercure Edinburgh Quay is located the heart of the city offering easy access to the EICC – Edinburgh International Conference Centre, Haymarket train station and the Princes Street. There is also free high speed Wi-Fi available throughout the hotel. Jonathan Sheard, SVP Operations Luxury, Upscale & Midscale Hotels, Accor UK & Ireland said, “We are extremely proud of the locally inspired touches of Mercure Edinburgh Quay, which draws on Edinburgh’s rich heritage. This marks our 75th hotel in the UK and Ireland and we are very excited to have opened this here in Scotland.” Related articles
